cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 105 miles ESE of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, forecast to move across Hispaniola today, reach the Bahamas Friday–Saturday, then curve northward just offshore the Florida-Georgia coast toward the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible first U.S. landfall along the southeast Florida coast Saturday (after crossing the Bahamas)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches confined to the north-western Bahamas (Andros, New Providence, Abacos, Berry Islands, Grand Bahama, Bimini)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings in effect for Puerto Rico, U.S./British Virgin Islands, Dominican Republic coasts, north Haiti coast, Turks & Caicos, south-central Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: From Florida’s Atlantic coast northward to the Georgia and Carolina coasts inside the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind gusts possible late Sunday night into Monday (8–11 % chance of sustained 34-kt winds)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate coastal inundation could occur if the center tracks close to shore, especially around high tide Monday
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 1–3 inches of rain with localized higher amounts, causing brief heavy downpours
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents likely beginning Sunday and persisting through Monday
